lead_paragraph: MIAMI HEAT The Heat changed little and grew older after capturing its first championship. Although the M.V.P. of the finals, Dwyane Wade, had a tiring summer with Team U.S.A., Miami should not be expected to lollygag through the regular season. Coach Pat Riley did not return to oversee complacency, nor did Alonzo Mourning. Jason Williams’s knee problems aside, Riley will have the Heat ready for the playoffs, where Shaquille O’Neal and Wade still form the most potent one-two punch in the conference.
